intro: Hieracium planchonianum subsp. planchonianum, commonly known as the French dandelion, is a perennial herb native to Europe. It features a rosette of basal leaves that are typically hairy and have a bluish-green color. The plant produces a single, tall, yellow flower head that blooms in the summer months. It is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. Its botanical characteristics make it a common weed in agricultural and urban areas.
